tracks.text: An old man with a white beard and top hat sits at a desk in a study.
A light shines through a keyhole.
A child unlocks the door and enters the dark study.
He walks past a carpet, an old phone, books, dolls, wooden cogs, and electronics.
A quill lies next to parchment. A magnifying glass by drawings.
The boy looks at a photo of himself with the hold man.
The man wears a red stone necklace.
In an old video, the boy watches as the man draws. The boy looks through a magnifying glass.
The boy approaches a wooden disc. Several models of a soldier stand frozen mid-stride.
The boy, wearing the red stone necklace, approaches the disc, and presses a button.
The disc spins, creating an optical illusion where the armored character appears to walk forward.
The other characters disappear. The soldier stops walking and looks around.
It jumps off the disc and looks around. Its chest has a crack, and a red stone grows and glows in the crack.
A disc spins, and a red heart pumps.
The soldier approaches a map of the furniture in the study.
A dotted line appears on the map, crossing to a nearby table with a red X.

The soldier lumbers past glasses and a book, approaching an old computer and keyboard. The soldier presses spacebar, and we get sucked into the computer, displaying a pixel art game labelled Sleep Walking Orchestra, copyright 1986.
A soldier sprite walks across a bridge, wanders in a tavern, walks through corridors, and jumps on a platform.
A brass golem with horns appears. Text says Golem attacks. Player selects Tools, Memories of Grandpa
The soldier's heart glows orange. Text, Memories of Grandpa give me courage.
The golem takes damage.
The golem shakes, and its pixels fall to the ground.
A yellow glow shoots from the soldier's chest. The golem grows back.
The golem leaps from the screen, and joins the soldier on the desk.
The brass golem has a yellow gem in its heart. Mushrooms grow out of its shoulders and body.
On the map, lines move from the first X, now labelled Bravely, to another X.
The golem sits on a desk. The soldier approaches a book of drawings.
The soldier and golem fall into the cartoonish world past trees, snow, ghosts, a skeleton horse, and a city made out of an apple core.
The 2 find creatures trapped in cages. They release the cages. The last cage holds a trembling bird with a skull head.
The soldier's heart gem shoots a silver light at the trembling, caged bird.
Balls with eyes, hair, and snake necks rise up from a single body.
The bird's heart gem glows, and it breaks the cage. Grabbing the soldier and golem, the bird flies into the air. The eyes shoot laser beams after it.
The bird flies out of the picture book, joining the soldier and golem on the table.
On the map, the lines move from the second X, Liberty, to a chest.
The bird flies, and the soldier and golem follow.
They step onto the disc, which rises in the air. The soldier stumbles, then begins to walk. Trees and grass grow as they walk in a circle.
The trees shrink back, as the 3 characters sit around a campfire.
The soldier's red heart gem glows. In the morning, they wake in the grass. At night, they approach a locked treasure chest.
A key emerges from the soldier's heart, and unlocks the chest.
A wizard with a hat and staff flies out from the chest, in a burst of green light. The wizard takes the soldiers hand. The 4 walk together, then dissolve into drawings.
The drawing lines vibrate, and become the outline of the band members playing drums and guitars.
The 4 band members play in a circle, with the study furniture gathered in the center.
The 4 characters run through a dungeon made of stone ruins.
The boy clutches the red stone necklace. The soldier's red heart gem glows.
The wizard's gem is green, the bird's is clear, the golem's is yellow, the soldier's is red.
The 4 character sprites walk through a pixel art game together.
They walk through the cartoon nightmare picture book world together.
They walk through a medieval town figurine world.
The characters walk and fly as an optical illusion on a spinning disc. The disc slows, leaving the characters still.
The boy looks out the window of the study.
Fade to black.
